instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3332: What is 820-3332? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U8900: What is U8900? This chip creates the GPU power rails on the 820-3332 board to the 2012 and early 2013 15‚Äù Retina Macbook Pros. It becomes desoldered and is the cause of no video and kernel panics/crashes in that model most of the time..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A GPU N13P-GT-W-A2 alternative?
threads.message:
I m working Mid 2012 retina 15" <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A with random freeze problem when using who application need more GPU power. ASD report GPU problem but you know apple no more replacing boards.
Replaced 2 times GPU with new one but now when loading OS freezing and EFI ASD not report error:(  ( Chines seller say new but i cant be sure DataCode is 1240 ) last month same problem solved by replace GPU from donor board and working without problem. 

So do you have any idea witch chip can be use alternative for this board or you can share known good chip?

Thanks

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A GPU N13P-GT-W-A2 alternative?
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A GPU N13P-GT-W-A2 alternative?
threads.message: Im not sure if it is really the problem of the quality of the chipsets. I got few boards in this condition,replaced GPUs all have no luck

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A GPU N13P-GT-W-A2 alternative?
threads.message:
Yes [USER="2"]dukefawks[/USER] resoldered first and replaced second time <CHIP>U8900</CHIP> before touch GPU

Its too interesting nobody write any where about this chip replaced worked  or didn't work at forums:(

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A GPU N13P-GT-W-A2 alternative?
threads.message:
Hi
I had a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> that had no boot issue,
Even after doing the <CHIP>U8900</CHIP> it was the same, I replaced the GPU and it is now fully working.
If its not working i would try a v-ram reflow or something, Doing GPU's on these boards is tricky and its much the same as the 2915's with the vram being effected by the heat of the rework.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A GPU N13P-GT-W-A2 alternative?
threads.message: thank you [USER="468"]ALB-Repairs[/USER]  i think you should be right because around v-ram guile is strong and cant be clean easy... I ll replace all from donors .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A GPU N13P-GT-W-A2 alternative?
threads.message:
[QUOTE="macfix, post: 24627"]thank you [USER="468"]ALB-Repairs[/USER] i think you should be right because around v-ram guile is strong and cant be clean easy... I ll replace all from donors .[/QUOTE]

Yes, the only way i got mine done easily was because it apple put weak glue on mine. it was a previously recalled board. i will be interested to see if it fixes your issues.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A GPU N13P-GT-W-A2 alternative?
threads.message: Just replace VRAM and GPU all at the same time. Any N13P-GT chip should work.
